result.markdown:
---
title: "Análise de Sobrevivência"
subtitle: "Modelos de regressão paramétricos"
author: "Ricardo Accioly"
format: html
---


### Introdução

Nesta etapa vamos começar a trabalhar com modelos de regressão paramétricos.

Os modelos que vamos ver se denominam modelos de tempo de falha (vida) acelerado TFA (AFT).

O conjunto de dados a seguir chamado "anderson.xlsx" consiste em tempos de remissão (em semanas) em 42 pacientes com leucemia, metade dos quais recebem uma certa nova terapia de tratamento e a outra metade recebe uma terapia de tratamento padrão. A variável de exposição de interesse é o tratamento (Rx = 0 se novo tratamento, Rx = 1 se tratamento padrão).

Duas outras variáveis para controle como potenciais confundidores são a contagem de glóbulos brancos (ou seja, logwbc) e sexo. O status de falha é definido pela variável recaída (0 se censurado, 1 se falhar).

### Carregando os dados


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(survival)
library(readxl)
dados <- read_xlsx("anderson.xlsx", col_names = TRUE )
summary(dados)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
     tempo           status            sexo            logwbc     
 Min.   : 1.00   Min.   :0.0000   Min.   :0.0000   Min.   :1.450  
 1st Qu.: 6.00   1st Qu.:0.0000   1st Qu.:0.0000   1st Qu.:2.303  
 Median :10.50   Median :1.0000   Median :0.0000   Median :2.800  
 Mean   :12.88   Mean   :0.7143   Mean   :0.4762   Mean   :2.930  
 3rd Qu.:18.50   3rd Qu.:1.0000   3rd Qu.:1.0000   3rd Qu.:3.490  
 Max.   :35.00   Max.   :1.0000   Max.   :1.0000   Max.   :5.000  
       Rx     
 Min.   :0.0  
 1st Qu.:0.0  
 Median :0.5  
 Mean   :0.5  
 3rd Qu.:1.0  
 Max.   :1.0  
```
:::
:::


### Ajuste Não Paramétrico


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ekm <- survfit(Surv(tempo,status)~Rx, data=dados)
tempo <- ekm$time
st <- ekm$surv
summary(ekm)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Call: survfit(formula = Surv(tempo, status) ~ Rx, data = dados)

                Rx=0 
 time n.risk n.event survival std.err lower 95% CI upper 95% CI
    6     21       3    0.857  0.0764        0.720        1.000
    7     17       1    0.807  0.0869        0.653        0.996
   10     15       1    0.753  0.0963        0.586        0.968
   13     12       1    0.690  0.1068        0.510        0.935
   16     11       1    0.627  0.1141        0.439        0.896
   22      7       1    0.538  0.1282        0.337        0.858
   23      6       1    0.448  0.1346        0.249        0.807

                Rx=1 
 time n.risk n.event survival std.err lower 95% CI upper 95% CI
    1     21       2   0.9048  0.0641      0.78754        1.000
    2     19       2   0.8095  0.0857      0.65785        0.996
    3     17       1   0.7619  0.0929      0.59988        0.968
    4     16       2   0.6667  0.1029      0.49268        0.902
    5     14       2   0.5714  0.1080      0.39455        0.828
    8     12       4   0.3810  0.1060      0.22085        0.657
   11      8       2   0.2857  0.0986      0.14529        0.562
   12      6       2   0.1905  0.0857      0.07887        0.460
   15      4       1   0.1429  0.0764      0.05011        0.407
   17      3       1   0.0952  0.0641      0.02549        0.356
   22      2       1   0.0476  0.0465      0.00703        0.322
   23      1       1   0.0000     NaN           NA           NA
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(ekm, xlab="T(semanas)",ylab="S(t)", lty=2:3)
legend("topright",c("Rx=0","Rx=1"), lty = 2:3)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula06_files/figure-html/ex_2-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Modelo Exponencial


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
leuc.exp.comp <- survreg(Surv(tempo, status) ~ sexo + logwbc + Rx, data = dados, dist = "exponential")
summary(leuc.exp.comp)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
survreg(formula = Surv(tempo, status) ~ sexo + logwbc + Rx, data = dados, 
    dist = "exponential")
              Value Std. Error     z      p
(Intercept)  5.9741     0.6965  8.58 <2e-16
sexo        -0.0859     0.3834 -0.22  0.823
logwbc      -0.8723     0.2212 -3.94  8e-05
Rx          -1.1156     0.4270 -2.61  0.009

Scale fixed at 1 

Exponential distribution
Loglik(model)= -100.7   Loglik(intercept only)= -116.8
	Chisq= 32.04 on 3 degrees of freedom, p= 5.1e-07 
Number of Newton-Raphson Iterations: 4 
n= 42 
```
:::
:::


## Automatizando ajuste


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(MASS)
leuc.exp.sel <- stepAIC(leuc.exp.comp, direction="backward", trace=FALSE)
summary(leuc.exp.sel)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
survreg(formula = Surv(tempo, status) ~ logwbc + Rx, data = dados, 
    dist = "exponential")
             Value Std. Error     z       p
(Intercept)  5.958      0.699  8.52 < 2e-16
logwbc      -0.884      0.216 -4.10 4.2e-05
Rx          -1.093      0.413 -2.65  0.0082

Scale fixed at 1 

Exponential distribution
Loglik(model)= -100.8   Loglik(intercept only)= -116.8
	Chisq= 31.99 on 2 degrees of freedom, p= 1.1e-07 
Number of Newton-Raphson Iterations: 4 
n= 42 
```
:::
:::


## Fazendo Previsões


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
novosdados <- data.frame(logwbc=c(2,2), Rx=c(0,1))
predict(leuc.exp.sel, type="lp", newdata=novosdados)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
       1        2 
4.189084 3.096010 
```
:::
:::


## Tempo Mediano


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
prev1 <-predict(leuc.exp.sel, type="quantile", newdata=novosdados, p=0.5)
prev1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
       1        2 
45.72161 15.32518 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
prev1[1]/prev1[2]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
       1 
2.983431 
```
:::
:::


## Comparando com outro quantil


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
prev2 <-predict(leuc.exp.sel, type="quantile", newdata=novosdados, p=0.7)
prev2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
       1        2 
79.41687 26.61931 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
prev2[1]/prev2[2]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
       1 
2.983431 
```
:::
:::


## Verificando o modelo


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(car)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Carregando pacotes exigidos: carData
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
par(mfrow = c(1, 2), cex = 0.6)
pred.lin <- predict(leuc.exp.sel, type = "lp")[dados$status == 1]
log.resid <- log(dados$tempo[dados$status == 1]) - pred.lin
plot(pred.lin, log.resid, main = "Grafico TA",
xlab = "log(valores ajustados)", ylab = "log(residuos)")
qqPlot(exp(log.resid), dist = "weibull",
shape = 1,
main = "Grafico Q-Q", xlab = "Quantis teoricos", ylab = "Quantis Empiricos")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula06_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 11 16
```
:::
:::


## Modelo Weibull


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
leuc.wei.comp <- survreg(Surv(tempo, status) ~ sexo + logwbc + Rx, data = dados, dist = "weibull")
summary(leuc.wei.comp)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
survreg(formula = Surv(tempo, status) ~ sexo + logwbc + Rx, data = dados, 
    dist = "weibull")
             Value Std. Error     z       p
(Intercept)  5.462      0.351 15.58 < 2e-16
sexo        -0.156      0.179 -0.87 0.38350
logwbc      -0.792      0.105 -7.54 4.8e-14
Rx          -0.722      0.201 -3.59 0.00034
Log(scale)  -0.815      0.144 -5.65 1.6e-08

Scale= 0.443 

Weibull distribution
Loglik(model)= -89.7   Loglik(intercept only)= -116.4
	Chisq= 53.42 on 3 degrees of freedom, p= 1.5e-11 
Number of Newton-Raphson Iterations: 7 
n= 42 
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
leuc.wei.sel <- stepAIC(leuc.wei.comp, direction="backward", trace=FALSE)
summary(leuc.wei.sel)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
survreg(formula = Surv(tempo, status) ~ logwbc + Rx, data = dados, 
    dist = "weibull")
             Value Std. Error     z       p
(Intercept)  5.399      0.364 14.84 < 2e-16
logwbc      -0.807      0.108 -7.45 9.7e-14
Rx          -0.659      0.189 -3.49 0.00049
Log(scale)  -0.793      0.142 -5.58 2.5e-08

Scale= 0.452 

Weibull distribution
Loglik(model)= -90.1   Loglik(intercept only)= -116.4
	Chisq= 52.68 on 2 degrees of freedom, p= 3.6e-12 
Number of Newton-Raphson Iterations: 7 
n= 42 
```
:::
:::


## Fazendo Previsões


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
novosdados <- data.frame(logwbc=c(2,2), Rx=c(0,1))
predict(leuc.wei.sel, type="lp", newdata=novosdados)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
       1        2 
3.784108 3.125137 
```
:::
:::


## Tempo Mediano


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
prev1 <-predict(leuc.wei.sel, type="quantile", newdata=novosdados, p=0.5)
prev1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
       1        2 
37.27311 19.28448 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
prev1[1]/prev1[2]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
       1 
1.932804 
```
:::
:::


## Comparando com outro quantil


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
prev2 <-predict(leuc.wei.sel, type="quantile", newdata=novosdados, p=0.7)
prev2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
       1        2 
47.85133 24.75747 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
prev2[1]/prev2[2]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
       1 
1.932804 
```
:::
:::


## Verificando o modelo


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
par(mfrow = c(1, 2), cex = 0.6)
pred.lin <- predict(leuc.wei.sel, type = "lp")[dados$status == 1]
log.resid <- log(dados$tempo[dados$status == 1]) - pred.lin
plot(pred.lin, log.resid, main = "Grafico TA",
xlab = "log(valores ajustados)", ylab = "log(residuos)")
qqPlot(exp(log.resid), dist = "weibull",
shape = 1/leuc.wei.sel$scale,
main = "Grafico Q-Q", xlab = "Quantis teoricos", ylab = "Quantis Empiricos")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula06_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672}
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 11 16
```
:::
:::


## Modelo Lognormal


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
leuc.logn.comp <- survreg(Surv(tempo, status) ~ sexo + logwbc + Rx, data = dados, dist = "lognormal")
summary(leuc.logn.comp)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
survreg(formula = Surv(tempo, status) ~ sexo + logwbc + Rx, data = dados, 
    dist = "lognormal")
              Value Std. Error     z       p
(Intercept)  4.9975     0.3924 12.74 < 2e-16
sexo        -0.0947     0.2211 -0.43 0.66862
logwbc      -0.7051     0.1251 -5.64 1.7e-08
Rx          -0.8539     0.2311 -3.69 0.00022
Log(scale)  -0.4424     0.1293 -3.42 0.00062

Scale= 0.642 

Log Normal distribution
Loglik(model)= -93.9   Loglik(intercept only)= -115.4
	Chisq= 43.08 on 3 degrees of freedom, p= 2.4e-09 
Number of Newton-Raphson Iterations: 6 
n= 42 
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
leuc.logn.sel <- stepAIC(leuc.logn.comp, direction="backward", trace=FALSE)
summary(leuc.logn.sel)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
survreg(formula = Surv(tempo, status) ~ logwbc + Rx, data = dados, 
    dist = "lognormal")
             Value Std. Error     z       p
(Intercept)  4.982      0.394 12.65 < 2e-16
logwbc      -0.716      0.123 -5.80 6.6e-09
Rx          -0.848      0.232 -3.66 0.00025
Log(scale)  -0.437      0.129 -3.39 0.00070

Scale= 0.646 

Log Normal distribution
Loglik(model)= -93.9   Loglik(intercept only)= -115.4
	Chisq= 42.9 on 2 degrees of freedom, p= 4.8e-10 
Number of Newton-Raphson Iterations: 6 
n= 42 
```
:::
:::


## Fazendo Previsões


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
novosdados <- data.frame(logwbc=c(2,2), Rx=c(0,1))
predict(leuc.logn.sel, type="lp", newdata=novosdados)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
       1        2 
3.549821 2.702019 
```
:::
:::


## Tempo Mediano


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
prev1 <-predict(leuc.logn.sel, type="quantile", newdata=novosdados, p=0.5)
prev1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
       1        2 
34.80708 14.90980 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
prev1[1]/prev1[2]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
      1 
2.33451 
```
:::
:::


## Comparando com outro quantil


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
prev2 <-predict(leuc.logn.sel, type="quantile", newdata=novosdados, p=0.7)
prev2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
       1        2 
48.83742 20.91977 
```

prev2[1]/prev2[2]

## Verificando o modelo


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
par(mfrow = c(1, 2), cex = 0.6)
pred.lin <- predict(leuc.logn.sel, type = "lp")[dados$status == 1]
log.resid <- log(dados$tempo[dados$status == 1]) - pred.lin
plot(pred.lin, log.resid, main = "Grafico TA",
xlab = "log(valores ajustados)", ylab = "log(residuos)")
qqPlot(exp(log.resid), dist = "norm",
sd = leuc.logn.sel$scale,
main = "Grafico Q-Q", xlab = "Quantis teoricos", ylab = "Quantis Empiricos")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula06_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-18-1.png){width=672}
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 11 12
```
:::
:::


## Modelo Loglogistico


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
leuc.logl.comp <- survreg(Surv(tempo, status) ~ sexo + logwbc + Rx, data = dados, dist = "loglogistic")
summary(leuc.logl.comp)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
survreg(formula = Surv(tempo, status) ~ sexo + logwbc + Rx, data = dados, 
    dist = "loglogistic")
              Value Std. Error     z       p
(Intercept)  5.0190     0.3518 14.27 < 2e-16
sexo        -0.0408     0.2027 -0.20 0.84065
logwbc      -0.7278     0.1098 -6.63 3.4e-11
Rx          -0.7494     0.2133 -3.51 0.00044
Log(scale)  -1.0894     0.1509 -7.22 5.1e-13

Scale= 0.336 

Log logistic distribution
Loglik(model)= -92.3   Loglik(intercept only)= -115.4
	Chisq= 46.08 on 3 degrees of freedom, p= 5.5e-10 
Number of Newton-Raphson Iterations: 6 
n= 42 
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
leuc.logl.sel <- stepAIC(leuc.logl.comp, direction="backward", trace=FALSE)
summary(leuc.logl.sel)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
survreg(formula = Surv(tempo, status) ~ logwbc + Rx, data = dados, 
    dist = "loglogistic")
             Value Std. Error     z       p
(Intercept)  5.008      0.348 14.40 < 2e-16
logwbc      -0.733      0.108 -6.81 9.8e-12
Rx          -0.743      0.210 -3.54   4e-04
Log(scale)  -1.089      0.151 -7.22 5.3e-13

Scale= 0.337 

Log logistic distribution
Loglik(model)= -92.3   Loglik(intercept only)= -115.4
	Chisq= 46.04 on 2 degrees of freedom, p= 1e-10 
Number of Newton-Raphson Iterations: 6 
n= 42 
```
:::
:::


## Fazendo Previsões


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
novosdados <- data.frame(logwbc=c(2,2), Rx=c(0,1))
predict(leuc.logl.sel, type="lp", newdata=novosdados)
```

```

```

## Verificando o modelo


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
par(mfrow = c(1, 2), cex = 0.6)
pred.lin <- predict(leuc.logl.sel, type = "lp")[dados$status == 1]
log.resid <- log(dados$tempo[dados$status == 1]) - pred.lin
plot(pred.lin, log.resid, main = "Grafico TA",
xlab = "log(valores ajustados)", ylab = "log(residuos)")
qqPlot(exp(log.resid), dist = "logis",
scale = leuc.logl.sel$scale,
main = "Grafico Q-Q", xlab = "Quantis teoricos", ylab = "Quantis Empiricos")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula06_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-24-1.png){width=672}
:::

```
[1] 11 12
```
:::
:::


## Comparação dos modelos


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tab.exp <- summary(leuc.exp.sel)
tab.exp
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
survreg(formula = Surv(tempo, status) ~ logwbc + Rx, data = dados, 
    dist = "exponential")
             Value Std. Error     z       p
(Intercept)  5.958      0.699  8.52 < 2e-16
logwbc      -0.884      0.216 -4.10 4.2e-05
Rx          -1.093      0.413 -2.65  0.0082

Scale fixed at 1 

Exponential distribution
Loglik(model)= -100.8   Loglik(intercept only)= -116.8
	Chisq= 31.99 on 2 degrees of freedom, p= 1.1e-07 
Number of Newton-Raphson Iterations: 4 
n= 42 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
tab.wei <- summary(leuc.wei.sel)
tab.wei
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
survreg(formula = Surv(tempo, status) ~ logwbc + Rx, data = dados, 
    dist = "weibull")
             Value Std. Error     z       p
(Intercept)  5.399      0.364 14.84 < 2e-16
logwbc      -0.807      0.108 -7.45 9.7e-14
Rx          -0.659      0.189 -3.49 0.00049
Log(scale)  -0.793      0.142 -5.58 2.5e-08

Scale= 0.452 

Weibull distribution
Loglik(model)= -90.1   Loglik(intercept only)= -116.4
	Chisq= 52.68 on 2 degrees of freedom, p= 3.6e-12 
Number of Newton-Raphson Iterations: 7 
n= 42 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
TRV <- 2*(tab.wei$loglik[1] - tab.exp$loglik[1])
pchisq(TRV, 1, lower.tail = F)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0.3953251
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
tab.ln <- summary(leuc.logn.sel)
tab.ln
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
survreg(formula = Surv(tempo, status) ~ logwbc + Rx, data = dados, 
    dist = "lognormal")
             Value Std. Error     z       p
(Intercept)  4.982      0.394 12.65 < 2e-16
logwbc      -0.716      0.123 -5.80 6.6e-09
Rx          -0.848      0.232 -3.66 0.00025
Log(scale)  -0.437      0.129 -3.39 0.00070

Scale= 0.646 

Log Normal distribution
Loglik(model)= -93.9   Loglik(intercept only)= -115.4
	Chisq= 42.9 on 2 degrees of freedom, p= 4.8e-10 
Number of Newton-Raphson Iterations: 6 
n= 42 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
tab.ll <- summary(leuc.logl.sel)
tab.ll
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
survreg(formula = Surv(tempo, status) ~ logwbc + Rx, data = dados, 
    dist = "loglogistic")
             Value Std. Error     z       p
(Intercept)  5.008      0.348 14.40 < 2e-16
logwbc      -0.733      0.108 -6.81 9.8e-12
Rx          -0.743      0.210 -3.54   4e-04
Log(scale)  -1.089      0.151 -7.22 5.3e-13

Scale= 0.337

n= 42 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
aic.exp <- -2*tab.exp$loglik[1] + 2*3
aic.exp
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 239.5333
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
aic.wei <- -2*tab.wei$loglik[1] + 2*4
aic.wei
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 240.8108
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
aic.ln <- -2*tab.ln$loglik[1] + 2*4
aic.ln
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 238.786
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
aic.ll <- -2*tab.ll$loglik[1] + 2*4
aic.ll
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 238.7022
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
aic <- c(aic.exp, aic.wei, aic.ln, aic.ll)
delta.aic <- aic - min(aic)
delta.aic
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0.83108732 2.10858745 0.08373248 0.00000000
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
peso.aic <- exp(-0.5*delta.aic)/sum(exp(-0.5*delta.aic))
sum(peso.aic)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
modelos <- data.frame(modelos=c("Exponencial", "Weibull",
                                "Lognormal", "Loglogistico"),
                      p_Akaike = peso.aic)
gt::gt(modelos)
```
